title: Last Stone Weight
description: You are given an array of integers stones where stones[i] is the weight of the ith stone. We are playing a game with the stones. On each turn, we choose the heaviest two stones and smash them together. Suppose the heaviest two stones have weights x and y with x <= y. The result of this smash is: If x == y, both stones are destroyed, and If x != y, the stone of weight x is destroyed, and the stone of weight y has new weight y - x. At the end of the game, there is at most one stone left. Return the weight of the last remaining stone. If there are no stones left, return 0.

examples.explanation: We combine 7 and 8 to get 1 so the array converts to [2,4,1,1,1] then, we combine 2 and 4 to get 2 so the array converts to [2,1,1,1] then, we combine 2 and 1 to get 1 so the array converts to [1,1,1] then, we combine 1 and 1 to get 0 so the array converts to [1] then that's the value of the last stone.

brute-force.name: Sorting Loop
brute-force.description: Sort in every iteration to find heaviest stones.

steps.instruction: Define the function last_stone_weight that takes stones.
Loop while more than 1 stone exists.
steps.hint: Sort the stones to easily access the heaviest ones.
Remove the two largest stones from the end of the sorted list.

steps.instruction: If they differ, add the difference back.
steps.hint: If the stones are not equal, push the difference back into the list.
Return the remaining stone or 0 if none are left.

optimal.name: Max Heap
optimal.description: Use a max heap (simulated with negative values) for efficiency.

steps.instruction: Define the function last_stone_weight that takes stones.
Create a max heap using negative values.
steps.placeholderCode:
import heapq
    stones = [-s for s in stones]
    heapq.heapify(stones)
steps.hint: Python's heapq is a min-heap, so negate values to simulate a max-heap.
steps.solutionCode:
import heapq
    stones = [-s for s in stones]
    heapq.heapify(stones)

steps.instruction: Loop while more than 1 stone exists.
steps.hint: Pop the two largest (most negative) stones.

steps.instruction: If second > first (since negative), push difference.
steps.placeholderCode:
if second > first:
            heapq.heappush(stones, first - second)
steps.hint:
Calculate the difference and push it back if non-zero.

Example:
Stones=[-8, -7, -4]. Pop -8 (8) and -7 (7).
8 > 7. Diff = 1. Push -1.
Stones=[-4, -1].
steps.solutionCode:
if second > first:
            heapq.heappush(stones, first - second)

steps.instruction: Return the absolute value of the last stone or 0.
steps.hint: Return the absolute value of the remaining stone.
